intro: Scabiosa moldavica, commonly known as the Moldavian scabious, is a flowering plant native to Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grassy areas, thriving in well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Scabiosa moldavica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
